title: kvkapiR
text: access KvK API, need API key. can apply API key learn different KvK APIs KvK Developer Portal.

title: kvkapiR
text: need API key current session, use kvk_set_api_key() function. ‚ö†Ô∏è Note: sets key current R session. key lost restart R.
code: kvk_set_api_key(api_key = "your_api_key_here")

title: kvkapiR
text: want store API key permanently, use kvk_store_api_key() function. saves key .Renviron file, making persist across R sessions. update existing API key, set overwrite parameter TRUE: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: must restart R changes take effect. ‚ö†Ô∏è Warning: use method can safely store API key system.
code: kvk_store_api_key(api_key = "your_api_key_here") kvk_store_api_key(api_key = "your_new_api_key", overwrite = TRUE)

title: kvkapiR
text: kvk_search() function wrapper KvK Search API. automatically paginates results (1,000 records). examples demonstrating perform searches handle API responses.

what: Example 1: single variable, less then 1.000 records
title: kvkapiR
text: Lets search KvK registrations village Koudum. Since small village fewer 1.000 registered businesses (API limit), records retrieved one request.

title: kvkapiR
text: package provides functions retrieve three types detailed profiles API: Basisprofiel (Basic Profile) - General company information Vestigingsprofiel (Establishment Profile) - Detailed branch/location information Naamgeving (Name History) - Historical company names üí∞ Note: profile retrieval costs EUR 0.02 per call (except government organizations - see ).

title: kvkapiR
text: retrieve real data production API:

title: kvkapiR
text: basic profile contains general company information:
code: # Get basic profile for a social organization (Stichting Gemeenschapscentrum Koudum) stichting_profile <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "01036576") stichting_profile #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 10 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     materieleRegistratie‚Ä¶¬π totaalWerkzamePersonen #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                                   <int> #> 1 01036576  Nee           Stichti‚Ä¶ 19660217                                    5 #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated name: ¬π‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 5 more variables: statutaireNaam <chr>, handelsnamen <list>, #> #   sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, `_embedded` <list>

title: kvkapiR
text: establishment profile provides detailed information specific location, including geographical data:
code: # Get establishment profile for the same organization stichting_vestiging <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(vestigingsnummer = "000007810083") stichting_vestiging #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 16 #>   vestigingsnummer kvkNummer rsin      indNonMailing materieleRegistratie$datu‚Ä¶¬π #>   <chr>            <chr>     <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                       #> 1 000007810083     01036576  002897295 Nee           19840825                    #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated name: ¬π‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 11 more variables: statutaireNaam <chr>, eersteHandelsnaam <chr>, #> #   indHoofdvestiging <chr>, indCommercieleVestiging <chr>, #> #   voltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   deeltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, handelsnamen <list>, adressen <list>, #> #   sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>  # The vestigingsprofiel contains geographical data for mapping and analysis # Access coordinates through the nested 'adressen' column: if (nrow(stichting_vestiging) > 0 && length(stichting_vestiging$adressen[[1]]) > 0) {   address_data <- stichting_vestiging$adressen[[1]]   if ("geoData" %in% names(address_data)) {     geo_info <- address_data$geoData     cat("Geographical coordinates available for mapping and spatial analysis\n")   } }

title: kvkapiR
text: kvkapiR package includes automatic usage tracking help monitor API calls costs.

title: kvkapiR
text: Use kvk_usage_report() see API usage costs multiple formats: different output formats serve different purposes: ‚Äúsummary‚Äù (default): Human-readable overview costs totals ‚Äútibble‚Äù: Structured data frame analysis, one row per month ‚Äútidy‚Äù: Long format one row per API call, perfect creating visualizations report shows: Monthly base fee: EUR 6.20 Per-query costs: EUR 0.02 profile retrievals (search free) Total costs call counts type
code: # View summary report (default format) kvk_usage_report() #> ‚Ñπ No usage data found. Make some API calls first!  # Get detailed tibble format for data analysis usage_data <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tibble") usage_data #> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows  # Get tidy format for visualization and analysis usage_tidy <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tidy") usage_tidy #> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows  # View specific month kvk_usage_report(year = 2025, month = 6) #> ‚Ñπ No usage data found. Make some API calls first!

title: kvkapiR
text: Protect unexpected costs usage alerts: limits exceeded, ‚Äôll see: First alert: Warning limit reached Reminder alerts: Notifications continued usage limits
code: # Set monthly cost limit of EUR 25 kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 25, period = "month") #> ‚úî Max cost: "25" per month  # Set call count limit kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 500, period = "month") #> ‚úî Max calls: 500 per month  # Set yearly limit kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 300, period = "year") #> ‚úî Max cost: "300" per year

title: kvkapiR
text: Export usage history external analysis:
code: # Export as tidy format (one row per call) kvk_export_usage("my_usage.csv", format = "tidy")  # Export as monthly summary kvk_export_usage("monthly_summary.csv", format = "monthly")

title: kvkapiR
text: Privacy-First Design: kvkapiR respects privacy following safeguards: Opt-: ‚Äôll asked permission tracking begins Local Storage: data stays computer (user directory) External Transmission: Nothing sent external servers Easy Disable: Multiple ways turn tracking First Time Setup: make first API call, ‚Äôll see: Control Options: Data Location: Usage data stored user directory using tools::R_user_dir("kvkapiR", "data") R 4.0+ ~/.kvkapiR/ older versions.
code: Enable usage tracking? (yes/no): # Permanently disable tracking Sys.setenv(KVKAPI_DISABLE_TRACKING = "true")  # Enable tracking programmatically options(kvkapiR.usage_tracking_opted_in = TRUE)  # Disable tracking programmatically   options(kvkapiR.usage_tracking_opted_in = FALSE)

title: kvkapiR
text: ‚ö†Ô∏è Important: costs mentioned charged Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) API usage. costs may change future, updates reflected future versions package.

title: kvkapiR
text: Monthly base fee: EUR 6.20 (charged API calls made) Search API: Free Profile APIs: EUR 0.02 per call (basisprofiel, vestigingsprofiel, naamgeving)

text: Government organizations exempt API costs can use APIs without incurring charges.

title: kvkapiR
text: KvK provides test environment can experiment API using production. information available KvK documentation page. search profile retrieval functions kvkapiR support testing mode via test_environment argument, set FALSE default. ü¶Ü Tip: test environment contains fictional data based characters Dutch comic magazine ‚ÄúDonald Duck‚Äù. Try searching names like ‚ÄúDonald‚Äù ‚ÄúDagobert‚Äù see API works sample data. test environment: Uses different base URL: https://api.kvk.nl/test/api/ Contains fictional business data testing purposes require API key (package uses built-test key) functionality endpoints production incur costs count towards usage tracking Displays informative messages API call, indicating test environment usage Note: using test environment, API call displays message like:
code: ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned.

title: kvkapiR
code: # Search in test environment - no API key needed # Note: You'll see a message indicating test environment usage test_results <- kvk_search(naam = "Donald", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_results #> # A tibble: 3 √ó 6 #>   kvkNummer vestigingsnummer naam                      adres        type  links  #>   <chr>     <chr>            <chr>                     <list>       <chr> <list> #> 1 68750110  000037178601     Test BV Donald Nevenvest‚Ä¶ <named list> neve‚Ä¶ <list> #> 2 68750110  000037178598     Test BV Donald            <named list> hoof‚Ä¶ <list> #> 3 68750110  NA               Test BV Donald            <NULL>       rech‚Ä¶ <list>  # Get test profiles - no costs incurred donald <- kvk_search(naam = "Donald", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_basisprofiel <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(   kvkNummer = donald$kvkNummer[1],    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_basisprofiel #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 11 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda‚Ä¶¬π materieleRegistratie‚Ä¶¬≤ #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 68750110  Ja            Test BV‚Ä¶ 20170519               20170519               #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated names: ¬π‚ÄãformeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ¬≤‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 6 more variables: totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, #> #   `_embedded` <list>  test_vestigingsprofiel <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(   vestigingsnummer = donald$vestigingsnummer[1],    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. test_vestigingsprofiel #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 17 #>   vestigingsnummer kvkNummer rsin      indNonMailing formeleRegistratiedatum #>   <chr>            <chr>     <chr>     <chr>         <chr>                   #> 1 000037178601     68750110  857587973 Ja            20170519                #> # ‚Ñπ 12 more variables: materieleRegistratie <tibble[,1]>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   eersteHandelsnaam <chr>, indHoofdvestiging <chr>, #> #   indCommercieleVestiging <chr>, voltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, deeltijdWerkzamePersonen <int>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, adressen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>  test_naamgeving <- kvk_get_naamgeving(   kvkNummer = donald$kvkNummer[1],    test_environment = TRUE ) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. title: kvkapiR
text: kvkapiR package provides comprehensive interface accessing KvK business data R : Simple authentication management Full API coverage (search profile retrieval) Test environment support development Automatic usage tracking cost monitoring Flexible search options including multiple filters Government organization fee exemption details, refer official KvK API documentation.

what: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: goal kvkapiR provide convenient R programming language interface Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) APIs. package built using httr2 package follows best practices wrapping APIs R, outlined httr2 documentation. simplifies authentication, request handling, response parsing interacting KvK API. package provides access KvK APIs: KvK Search API KvK Basisprofiel API KvK Vestigingsprofiel API KvK Naamgeving API details can found developers website KvK.

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: package submitted CRAN review. ‚Äôs accepted CRAN status badge shows ‚ÄúCRAN: OK‚Äù, can install stable version CRAN : , can install current stable version GitHub : install latest development version:
code: install.packages("kvkapiR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("coeneisma/kvkapiR", ref = "development")

title: Interface to the Dutch Chamber of Commerce (KvK) API
text: profile retrieval costs EUR 0.02 (free government organizations):
code: # Get basic company profile (using a social organization) profile <- kvk_get_basisprofiel("01036576")  # Get establishment details establishment <- kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel("000007810083")  # Get name history names <- kvk_get_naamgeving("01036576")

what: Export usage data to CSV file ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
title: Export usage data to CSV file ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
text: Export KvK API usage data CSV file external analysis, reporting, record keeping. Choose detailed call--call data monthly aggregated summaries.

title: Export usage data to CSV file ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
code: kvk_export_usage(file_path, format = "tidy")

title: Export usage data to CSV file ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
text: file_path Character string specifying path CSV file saved. Can include relative absolute paths. file created exist, overwritten . format Character string specifying export format: "tidy" (default): One row per API call detailed information including timestamp, date, call type, metadata. Perfect creating custom visualizations detailed analysis. "monthly": Aggregated monthly summary call counts type cost calculations. Ideal reporting budget tracking.

title: Export usage data to CSV file ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effect creating CSV file.

title: Export usage data to CSV file ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
text: exported data includes production API calls. Test environment calls included export. Tidy format includes columns: timestamp: Exact time API call date: Date API call year, month: Extracted date components call_type: Type API call (search, basisprofiel, etc.) test_environment: Always FALSE production calls Monthly format includes columns: Year, Month: Time period Search, Basisprofiel, Vestiging, Naamgeving: Call counts type Costs (EUR): Total costs including base fee query charges

title: Export usage data to CSV file ‚Äî kvk_export_usage
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Export detailed call data for analysis kvk_export_usage("my_api_usage.csv", format = "tidy")  # Export monthly summary for reporting kvk_export_usage("monthly_report.csv", format = "monthly")  # Export to specific directory kvk_export_usage("reports/2025_usage.csv", format = "tidy")  # Use in data analysis workflow kvk_export_usage("temp_usage.csv", format = "tidy") usage_data <- read.csv("temp_usage.csv") # Perform custom analysis... }

what: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function retrieves basis profile given KvK number (kvkNummer) using KvK Basisprofiel API. Users can also request additional data, owner information, main establishment, locations specifying include parameter.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
code: kvk_get_basisprofiel(   kvkNummer,   geoData = FALSE,   include = NULL,   test_environment = FALSE )

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: kvkNummer string representing KvK number basis profile requested. geoData logical value indicating whether geo-data included response. Defaults FALSE. TRUE, response include geo-data. include character vector specifying additional data include. Possible values: "eigenaar" (owner), "hoofdvestiging" (main establishment), "vestigingen" (locations). Defaults NULL (basic profile ). test_environment logical value indicating whether use test environment (TRUE) production environment (FALSE). Defaults FALSE.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: tibble containing retrieved basis profile. geoData = TRUE, returned tibble also include geographical information.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
text: function also supports test_environment argument. set TRUE, function query KvK test API environment, providing set fictitious test data. function retrieves data KvK Basisprofiel API. geoData = TRUE, geo-data (e.g., location data) included returned profile. include parameter allows users request additional details, ownership information business locations. Important: test_environment = TRUE, actual API key required. using test data KvK test environment.

title: Retrieve the Basisprofiel for a given KvK number ‚Äî kvk_get_basisprofiel
code: # Examples using the production API (requires API key) # Retrieve basis profile for a given KvK number without geo-data basis_profile <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084") print(basis_profile) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 10 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda‚Ä¶¬π materieleRegistratie‚Ä¶¬≤ #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 69599084  Nee           Flexmet‚Ä¶ 20180302               20170914               #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated names: ¬π‚ÄãformeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ¬≤‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 6 more variables: materieleRegistratie$datumEinde <chr>, #> #   totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, #> #   links <list>, `_embedded` <list>  # Retrieve basis profile with geo-data basis_profile_geo <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084", geoData = TRUE)  # Retrieve basis profile including owner information basis_profile_owner <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "69599084", include = "eigenaar")  # Examples using test environment (no API key required) # These use the KvK test dataset with Donald Duck themed businesses basis_profile_test <- kvk_get_basisprofiel(kvkNummer = "68727720", test_environment = TRUE) #> ‚Ñπ You are using the KvK test environment. Test data will be returned. print(basis_profile_test) #> # A tibble: 1 √ó 11 #>   kvkNummer indNonMailing naam     formeleRegistratieda‚Ä¶¬π materieleRegistratie‚Ä¶¬≤ #>   <chr>     <chr>         <chr>    <chr>                  <chr>                  #> 1 68727720  Ja            Test NV‚Ä¶ 20170516               20160516               #> # ‚Ñπ abbreviated names: ¬π‚ÄãformeleRegistratiedatum, #> #   ¬≤‚ÄãmaterieleRegistratie$datumAanvang #> # ‚Ñπ 6 more variables: totaalWerkzamePersonen <int>, statutaireNaam <chr>, #> #   handelsnamen <list>, sbiActiviteiten <list>, links <list>, #> #   `_embedded` <list>

title: Reset usage tracking data ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
text: Permanently delete stored API usage data. action undone clear entire usage history including call counts, timestamps, cost calculations.

title: Reset usage tracking data ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
code: kvk_reset_usage()

title: Reset usage tracking data ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
text: Invisibly returns NULL. function called side effect deleting usage data file.

title: Reset usage tracking data ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
text: function removes usage tracking file user data directory. reset: usage history permanently deleted kvk_usage_report show data Cost calculations restart zero Usage alerts use new baseline function affects stored usage data. change: Usage alert settings (stored R options) API key configuration Package preferences can useful : Starting fresh tracking billing period Clearing test data production use Privacy reasons sharing computer Troubleshooting usage tracking issues

title: Reset usage tracking data ‚Äî kvk_reset_usage
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Clear all usage history kvk_reset_usage()  # Verify reset worked kvk_usage_report()  # Should show "No usage data found"  # Usage tracking will restart with new API calls results <- kvk_search(plaats = "Amsterdam") kvk_usage_report()  # Will show the new call }

what: Set usage and cost alerts ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
title: Set usage and cost alerts ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
text: Configure automatic alerts monitor KvK API usage prevent unexpected costs. Alerts triggered real-time exceed specified limits API calls.

title: Set usage and cost alerts ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
code: kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = NULL, max_cost = NULL, period = "month")

title: Set usage and cost alerts ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
text: max_calls Integer maximum number API calls triggering alerts. reached, see danger alert. Continued usage beyond limit show reminder warnings. max_cost Numeric character maximum cost triggering alerts. Can specified number (e.g., 25) string (e.g., "EUR 25"). Costs include monthly base fee (EUR 6.20) per-query charges (EUR 0.02). period Character string specifying alert period: "month" (default): Monitor usage within calendar month "year": Monitor usage within calendar year "total": Monitor cumulative usage across time

title: Set usage and cost alerts ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
text: Usage alerts help stay within budget monitor API consumption patterns. limits exceeded, package displays informative messages: First alert: Danger alert limit first reached Reminder alerts: Warning messages continued usage limits Alert settings stored R options current session apply subsequent API calls. must specify least one max_calls max_cost. production API calls count towards limits. Test environment calls ignored.

title: Set usage and cost alerts ‚Äî kvk_usage_alert
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Set monthly call limit kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 100, period = "month")  # Set monthly cost limit   kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 25, period = "month")  # Set both call and cost limits kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 500, max_cost = "EUR 50", period = "month")  # Set yearly limits for annual budget planning kvk_usage_alert(max_cost = 300, period = "year")  # Monitor total cumulative usage kvk_usage_alert(max_calls = 1000, period = "total") }

title: Generate API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
text: Display return API usage statistics costs various formats. function helps monitor KvK API usage associated costs.

title: Generate API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
code: kvk_usage_report(format = "summary", year = NULL, month = NULL)

title: Generate API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
text: format Character string specifying output format: "summary" (default): Human-readable console output costs call counts "tibble": Monthly aggregated data tibble, one row per month "tidy": Detailed data one row per API call, suitable analysis visualization year Integer year filter results (e.g., 2025). NULL, shows years. month Integer month (1-12) filter results. used year also specified.

title: Generate API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
text: format = "summary": Invisible NULL (output printed console) format = "tibble": tibble monthly usage summary format = "tidy": tibble detailed call--call data

title: Generate API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
text: summary format displays: API call counts type (search calls free) Cost breakdown including monthly base fee (EUR 6.20) query costs (EUR 0.02 per profile call) Total costs number active months tibble format provides monthly aggregated data suitable reporting analysis. tidy format provides raw call data perfect creating custom visualizations. production API calls included reports. Test environment calls tracked reported.

title: Generate API usage report ‚Äî kvk_usage_report
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Display human-readable summary kvk_usage_report()  # Get monthly summary as tibble monthly_data <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tibble") print(monthly_data)  # Get detailed call data for custom analysis call_data <- kvk_usage_report(format = "tidy") head(call_data)    # View specific month kvk_usage_report(year = 2025, month = 6)  # View entire year kvk_usage_report(year = 2025) }

title: kvkapiR 0.1.2
text: kvk_search() searches Dutch Chamber Commerce (KvK) business registry automatic pagination 1,000 results. kvk_get_basisprofiel(), kvk_get_vestigingsprofiel(), kvk_get_naamgeving() retrieve detailed business profiles, establishment information, company name histories. kvk_usage_report() displays API usage statistics costs multiple output formats. kvk_usage_alert() sets usage cost limits real-time alerts. kvk_export_usage() exports usage data CSV tidy monthly formats. kvk_reset_usage() clears usage tracking history. functions support test environment via test_environment = TRUE cost-free testing. Search functions support multiple business types single query street-search. Automatic error handling user-friendly messages Dutch IPD code translations.

title: kvkapiR 0.1.2
text: Added comprehensive vignette practical examples cost information. Added pkgdown website custom KvK color scheme.
